xxl.collections
Class ListQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.collections.ListQueue
public class ListQueue
extends AbstractQueue
implements FIFOQueue

This class provides an implementation of the Queue interface with a FIFO (first in, first out) strategy that internally uses a list to store its elements. It implements the peek method but not the remove method.

The performance of the queue depends on the performance of the internally used list (e.g., an ArrayList guaratees for insertion an amortized constant time, that is, adding n elements requires O(n) time)

Usage example (1). 

     // create a new list queue (that uses a linked list to store its elements per default)
 
     ListQueue queue = new ListQueue();
 
     // create an iteration over 20 random Integers (between 0 and 100)
 
     Cursor cursor = new RandomIntegers(100, 20);
 
     // insert all elements of the given iterator
 
     queue.insertAll(cursor);
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());
 
     // close the open queue and cursor after use
 
     queue.close();
     cursor.close();
Usage example (2). 
     // create an iteration over 20 random Integers (between 0 and 100)
 
     cursor = new RandomIntegers(100, 20);
 
     // create a new list queue that uses an array list to store its elements and that contains
     // all elements of the given iterator
 
     queue = new ListQueue(new ArrayList(), cursor);
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());
 
     // close the open queue and cursor after use
 
     queue.close();
     cursor.close();

See Also:
Function, Iterator, LinkedList, List, NoSuchElementException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new ListQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). It may be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of lists, an iterator or without any parameters. An array (parameter list) of lists will be used to initialize the internally used list with the list at index 0 and an iterator will be used to insert the contained elements into the new ListQueue.
See Also:
Function

list

protected List list
The list is internally used to store the elements of the queue.
Constructor Detail

ListQueue

public ListQueue(List list)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the list. The specified list is internally used to store the elements of the queue.
Parameters:
list - the list that is used to initialize the internally used list.

ListQueue

public ListQueue()
Constructs an empty queue. This queue instantiates a new LinkedList in order to store its elements.

ListQueue

public ListQueue(List list,
                 Iterator iterator)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the list and the specified iterator. For the most cases the list is used to initialize the internally used list in order to guartantee a desired performance. This constructor calls the constructor with the specified list and uses the insertAll method to insert the elements of the specified iterator.
Parameters:
list - the list that is used to initialize the internally used list.
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be placed into this queue.

ListQueue

public ListQueue(Iterator iterator)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified iterator. This queue instantiates a new LinkedList in order to store its elements. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ListQueue(new LinkedList(), iterator).
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be placed into this queue.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this queue. If this queue contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.

supportsPeek

public boolean supportsPeek()
Returns true if the peek operation is supported by this queue. (In other words, returns true if peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
Overrides:
supportsPeek in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
true if the peek operation is supported by this queue.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a ListQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of a ListQueue.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
